metadata.Title: CVE-2022-21222 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The package css-what before 2.1.3 are vulnerable to Regular ExpressionDenial of Service (ReDoS) due to the usage of insecure regular expressionin the re_attr variable of index.js. The exploitation of this vulnerabilitycould be triggered via the parse function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-css-what - 2.1.0-1+deb10u1build0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-css-what package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-1+deb10u1build0.18.04.1').
